text: this year will be the first time goal
line technology is used at a world cup
the system relies on 14 high-speed
cameras around the pitch which can tell
when the ball crosses the line referees
will wear a watch which vibrates to
notify them when the goal is confirmed
the 2010 fifa world cup in south africa
saw a total of a hundred and forty five
goals scored that's an average of almost
two point three goals in each and every
game in Germany 2006 there were a
hundred and forty seven goals in Japan
Korea 2002 we saw a hundred and
sixty-one and in France 98 a hundred and
seventy-one speaking of goals one record
that may be broken this year is that of
the all-time record goalscorer at the
world cup finals the current holder is
former Brazilian striker Ronaldo with 15
goals with Brazil being such a massive
country one of the challenges facing the
teams will be the travelling between
games the teams will have to travel an
average of seven and a half thousand
kilometers between the venues the final
will be held here in the iconic Maracana
in front of seventy nine thousand fans
